comment.text: Participates in the detoxification of a plethora of hydrazine and arylamine drugs. Catalyzes the N- or O-acetylation of various arylamine and heterocyclic amine substrates and is able to bioactivate several known carcinogens.
Acetyl-CoA + an arylamine = CoA + an N-acetylarylamine.
Polymorphisms in NAT2 are the cause of slow and fast acetylation phenotypes [MIM:243400] and influence drug therapy response and susceptibility to chemical toxicity or carcinogenicity.
Belongs to the arylamine N-acetyltransferase family.

comment.name: Atlas of Genetics and Cytogenetics in Oncology and Haematology
